title: Future Of Federal Environmental Program In Doubt
teaser: Complaints from landowners has the U.S. Fish and Wildlife Service thinking about ending a program that reintroduces red wolves into the wild.
contentencoded:
Red wolves once roamed across much of the southeastern United States.

Today, only about one hundred exist in North Carolina, because of a federal reintroduction effort.

But complaints from landowners has the U.S. Fish and Wildlife Service thinking about ending the program.

From the Here & Now Contributors Network, WUNC's Dave Dewitt reports.

  • WUNC: Red Wolves: A Future In Doubt

Reporter

  • Dave Dewitt, environment reporter for WUNC in Chapel Hill. He tweets @DaveDeWitt.
